Description: Seven fragments of a wooden sarcophagus; painted detail on plaster on both exterior and interior sides. According to Zitman (2010, 115, 227 (II)) EA46661-582 is the same object as EA47607-618.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Dimensions: Height: 13.60 centimetres (Numbered fragment, 4th fragment in group shot image)
Length: 42.90 centimetres (Numbered fragment, 4th fragment in group shot image)
Weight: 510 grammes (Numbered fragment, 4th fragment in group shot image)
Depth: 3.20 centimetres (Numbered fragment, 4th fragment in group shot image)
Bibliographic references: Zitman 2010 / The necropolis of Assiut: a case study of local Egyptian funerary culture from the Old Kingdom to the end of the Middle Kingdom (II, 115, 227)
